Photograph Gallery, 217 Main st,
Richmond, Va. no 9--3t*

div3.head: By E. S. Pleasants, Auct.
div3.p:
Horses, Hacks, &c, at auction.--On Friday, the 13th inst, at 10 o'clock. I will sell at the stable of Mr. James J Sutherland, Franklin street, five doors above the Exchange Hotel, his entire stock of Horses, Carriages, Harness, &c, consisting of
8 very superior horses
4 hacks and harness, in very good condition.
At the same time, will be hired for the balance of the year four negro men.
To parties wishing to engage in a very profitable business the above sale offers a most excellent opportunity.
div3.closer:
E S, Pleasants,
Auctioneer. no 9

div3.p: Household and Kitchen Furniture, Key of House, &c, for sale at auction.--On Tuesday, the 10th inst, at 10 o'clock, I will sell at the residence over the store formerly occupied by C Hartwell & Co, between 8th and 9th streets, on Broad, an excellent and general assortment of Household and kitchen furniture, &c.

After which will be sold the Key of said residence, which contains nine rooms, together with kitchen, servants' rooms, &c. The apartments are well supplied with very complete conveniences of gas and water.
div3.closer:
N S Pleasants,
Auctioneer. no 7

div3.head: By Lea & James, Auct'rs.
div3.p: Receiver's Sale of Slaves.--Will be sold at the auction room of Lea & James, in the city of Richmond, on Saturday, the 14th day of November, at 10 o'clock A M, a family of slaves, nine in number, very valuable.
div3.closer:
Francis L Smith,
Receiver for District No. 1. no 9--tds

div3.head: Small Farm for sale in Albemarle.
div3.p:
--Will be sold on the premises, about three miles from Cobham Depot, on Thursday, the 19th November, (or the next fair day,) a tract of about 180 acres of land.
This land lies on the slope of the Southwest Mountain, and is of the finest quality of Albemarle red land.
It is well taken in grass, except about 25 acres in timber, and is all under good enclosure.
A better chance for a small farm rarely occurs in so desirable a neighborhood.

Terms--Cash or credit, at the option of the purchaser.
Address the undersigned.
div3.closer:
Wm D Meriwether,
Cobham, Albemarle. se 9--3tawtds

div3.head:
L. M. West, Auctioneer,
[Wilmington, N C.]
div3.p: Wilmington Auction Sales.--Octavius Cohen will sell, on Tuesday, 10th November next, at the Rock Spring warehouse, in Wilmington, at 9 o'clock A M, five cargoes Dry Goods, imported into this city per steamers Dow, Flora, and Haugs, selected by Messrs A Collin & Co, Manchester.

list.item: 7 bales white, red and scarlet flannel

41 cases and bales Turkey-red, Madder, Madras &c, hdkfs
12 cases cotton and merino hose and half hose

16 cases women's and children's expansion skirts
20 cases and casks files and rasps

div3.p:
The above goods will be ready for inspection on Saturday, the 7th and Monday the 9th, of November.
Terms cash.

div3.head: By Kent, Paine & Co., Auct'rs.
div3.p:
Dry Goods at auction.--On Wednesday, 11th Nov, commencing at 10 o'clock, we will sell at our warehouse a variety of choice and desirable
Dry Goods,
comprising many scarce and seasonable goods now in great demand.
Particulars hereafter.

div3.head: Public sale of land.
div3.p:
--I will sell at public auction, on the 10th day of November next, my Farm, known as "Marl Hill," containing 505 acres, lying in Caroline county, between the Mattaponi river and Pole-Cat creek, and immediately on the Richmond and Fredericksburg Railroad, one-quarter of a mile from Pinola Station.
The house is large and comfortable, with the necessary out houses, and a church and a daily mall each in 500 yards of the door.
The open land is in a high state of improvement, and about 250 acres especially adapted to the growth of wheat.
Also, some 40 or 50 acres of the celebrated Pole-Cat bottom, which, at a cost of one or two hundred dollars, may be made equal to any land in the State.
Terms--Made known on the day of sale.

div3.head: Attention, Foreign Legion.
div3.p:
--Meet, fully armed and equipped for inspection, at Old Market Hall, on Monday evening, Nov. 9th, at 4 o'clock precisely.
A full attendance is required, as a new pass will be issued to all members.
div3.closer:
By order of Capt L'Ecuyes.
G Warren, A O S. no 7--2t*

Important business will be submitted.
div3.closer:

E S Turpin, 2d Serg't. no 7--2t*

div3.head: A good drinking House.
div3.p: --Now, as almost every one has, or can get, license to keep a drinking house, and as the greater part of them keep very mean "pop skull," we believe it to be our duty to inform the community where they can get a good drink, and take pleasure in recommending Mr. F B Coan, under Odd Fellows' Hall, corner of Franklin and Mayo streets, where can be found the very best of all kinds of Liquors, at reasonable prices.

Fin is a good fellow, and deserves patronage.
Give him a call.

div3.head: New Harness for sale.
div3.p:
--We have on hand five new sets of double and single harness; also, several sets of double and single second-hand harness, and an assortment of saddles and bridles.
Any person in need of anything in our line would do well to give us a call.
div3.closer:
Taylor & Smith;
Opposite New Theatre. no 7--2t*

div3.closer:

Between Broad and New Market no 5--3t*

div3.head: By James M. Taylor, Auctioneer.
div3.p:
Farm for rent — Stock of Horses, Mules.
cows, Hogs, Corn, Shucks, Straw, Farming Implements of all kinds, Wood, &c, at auction.--At the request of Mr. R G Crouch, who is now in the army, I will rent out on Tuesday, 17th November, at 10 o'clock A M, his farm in the county of Henrico, 12 miles west of Richmond, and near James river canal, containing $55 acres of land, with a good dwelling house with 4 rooms, and all the usual out-building.

Immediately after renting the farm, I will proceed to sell all his entire stock.
consisting of 4 good mules, horses, cows, hogs, &c; corn, fodder, shucks, straw, &c; also 60 cords good seasoned wood, in one mile of the James river and Tockstoe railroad.
After the sale, will be hired out 7 negro men, valuable farm hands, for the balance of this year and also for the next year.

div3.head: House and lot in Sidney for sale at auction,
div3.p:
--Will be sold on the premises, on Thursday, November 12th, at 4½ o'clock P M, the valuable house and lot situated on the north side of Cumberland street, between Cherry and Calvert. The lot fronts 21½ feet, and runs back 145 feet. The house is a frame building, and has four or five rooms.
Terms made known at sale.

Administratrix's sale of an extensive and valuable lot of Machinery, Tools, Lumber, &c, at auction.--Will be sold on Tuesday, the 10th November, at 10 o'clock A M, on the west side of the Plankroad, in the town of Sidney, at the late residence of Thomas Suter, dec'd, near Camp Winder, a large and valuable lot of machinery, tools, lumber, &c, of every description, used in an establishment for turning and boring, consisting in part of one valuable lathe, with a good horse power; a large lot of belting, together with all the usual kind of tools used in an establishment of the kind; a very fine lot of well-seasoned oak, pine, poplar, ashe, &c, timber; a lot of logs, suitable for pumps; a lot of screws, bolts, &c, &c; one 2-horse wagon; one or two log carriages, &c Persons wishing to supply themselves with any of the above enumerated articles, particularly those in want of hardware, will do well to attend the sale, as it is supposed to be the most extensive and valuable lot of tools, &c, in the Confederacy that will be offered for sale probably during the war.
div3.closer:
Mary Suter,
Adm'x of Thos. Suter, dec'd.
Sale by Jas M Taylor, Auct. no 6--4t

div3.head: Cottage residence,
div3.p:
with half an acre of Ground, in the town of Sidney, on Main street, adjoining the residence of Mr C M Nimmo, at auction.--Immediately after the above sale of Mrs Sutar's, at the request of Mr. G A Armstrong.
I will sell, on the promises, the desirable cottage residence located as above.
The house has four rooms and kitchen nearly new, and all in good order.
div3.closer:
Jas M Taylor,
Auctioneer. no 7--3t

div3.head: Brick store and dwelling-house in Rocketts, for sale at auction.
div3.p:
--Will be sold on Wednesday next, 11th inst, at 4 o'clock P M, on the promises, the store and dwelling-house occupied by Jas F Cavedo, in Rocketts, corner of Main and Elm sts, near the store of R O Haskins, Esq. The house contains five rooms besides the store.
There are two lost fronting 42 feet 9 inches on Main st, and running back, lot, No. 1, 98 feet 5 inches, and lot No. 2, 69 feet 6 inches. It is a very desirable stand for business, and person in want would do well to attend the sale.
After the sale of the property the store fixtures will be sold.
div3.closer:
Jas M Taylor,
Auctioneer. no 5

div3.head: Trustee's sale of desirable building lots in Sidney for sale at auction.
div3.p: --Will be sold on Thursday, the 12th day of November, on the premises, at 4 o'clock P M, 7 desirable building lots in the town of Sidney, fronting on Cherry and Culvert sts, each having a front of 30 feet and running back 150 feet to an alley.
These lots are considered to be very desirable for private residences.
Terms liberal, and made known on the day of sale.

div3.head: Valuable private residence on Leigh street for sale at auction.
div3.p:
--Will be sold on Tuesday, the 10th November, on the premises, at 4½ o'clock P M, the large brick dwelling at the corner of Leigh and Adams sts, and at present occupied by Mr. McKeever, and formerly by the late John H Hilliard, dec'd. The house has 11 rooms, kitchen, smokehouse, wood-house, carriage-house, and stable, the yard well set in choice fruit trees and grapes, with a well of fine water in the yard, and also supplied with city water and gas through the house.
The lot fronts 81 feet on Leigh st and runs back 160 feet; all in good order.
Persons wishing to secure a large dwelling with a large lot attached, with all the usual buildings, would do well to attend the sale.--Immediate possession can be had.
Terms--Made known on the day of sale.

div3.p: --On Tuesday, 10th inst, commencing at 10 o'clock A M, we will sell at out salesrooms, No. 192 Main st, a miscellaneous assortment of Furniture, Pianos, Crockery, &c, consisting of the following and other articles:

div3.head: By Pulliam, Hanes & Weisiger, Auct'rs.
div3.p:
Glenwood Hall for Sale at Auction.--At the request of A G Stubbs, Esq, we will sell at auction, on the premises, on Tuesday evening, the 10th inst, at 4 o'clock, the beautiful place called Glenwood Hall, containing twenty-five acres of excellent land, with a good spring near the house, and a fine stream of water running through it. Fine locations for ice ponds and houses.
Wood sufficient for the use of the place, with a new and excellent dwelling-house containing eight or ten rooms, and a kitchen with four rooms.
Located only 1Û miles from the city, near the Stony Run road, it is a very desirable residence for any gentleman doing business in Richmond.
A plan of the grounds can be seen at our office.
div3.closer:
Pulliam, Hanes & Weliger,
Auctioneers. no 4--6t*

div3.head: The Natural Bridge property at public auction.
div3.p:
--The subscribers will offer for sale, at auction, on Tuesday, the 26th day of November, that valuable and widely known property, the Natural Bridge, attached to which are from 150 to 175 acres of land, with a large and commodious Hotel, within a few moments' walk of the Bridge, deservedly considered one of the best Tavern stands in Western Virginia.
Of the Bridge itself, its magnificent scenery and grand natural beauties, it is unnecessary to speak.
They have been the theme of the poet and the historian, and the object of wondering admiration to the tourist of every clime for more than a century.

At the same time, we will sell all the Furniture of the Hotel, consisting of everything to be found in a first class, well furnished Hotel, together with all the apparatus for a large Kitchen establishment.
Also, 30 or 40 head of hogs, 8 or 10 fine milch Cows, several head of fat Cattle, several Horses, a Hack and Haraces, Wagon, and all the necessary farming implements on the place.

As a permanent investment this property offers many inducements to capitalists, being accrue from invasion, and at all times affording a good percentage on the amount invested.
Their attention is particularly invited to the sale to take place on the day above named.

Old stand of Putney & Watts. no 6--2t*

div3.head: For rent
div3.p:
--At public auction, on Monday, the 9th inst, at 5 o'clock P M, a small market Farm, about 1½ miles below the city, on the Darbytown road, containing seven acres. The land is rich and produces vegetables finely.
There are twenty-five apple trees on the place.
The dwelling-house has four rooms.
There is also a good kitchen, stables, &c. The renter can have the privilege of taking it one or three years.

Particulars on day of sale.

div3.head: By Hill, Dickinson & Co., Auct'rs.

Hill, Dickinson & Co,

div3.head: A very likely free negro at auction.
div3.p: --In pursuance of an order of the Hustings Court of the city of Richmond I will sell on Monday, the 9th day of November, 1863, (that being Court day,) is front of the City Hall, at 10 ½ o'clock A M, to the highest bidder, for cash, a very likely free negro man, named Sylvanus T Brown, convicted of grand larceny by said Court and ordered to be sold into absolute slavery.
Also, at the same time and place, an elderly man, named John, committed as a runaway, and, ordered to be sold as such.
div3.closer:
Thos U Dudley,
Serg't City of Richmond. no 5--4t

div3.head:
Commissioner's Office,
Richmond, Nov. 5th, 1863.
div3.p: To the Creditors of William J. Hobard, dec'd, and all others concerned.--You are hereby notified that I have postponed the taking of the accounts and making the inquiries directed by the decrees of Henrico County Court, entered on the 8th of September, 1863, in the case of Hubbard, &c, vs. Hubbard, &c, depending therein, until Tuesday next, the 10th inst., at which time you are required to attend at my office, with the necessary evidence to enable me to do so. Given under my hand as Commissioner is Chancery of the said Court the day and year first aforesaid.

C. S. W. Miller would beg leave to inform his friends and the public in general that he will continue his instructions on the Piano to those who may desire his services and favor him with their continuance.
Applications at Mr. A Spott's Jewelry Store, on Broad street, between 4th and 6th, will meet with prompt attention.
"I would cheerfully recommend Mr. C. W. William a faithful teacher.

div3.head: Consolidated Steamship Company of Charleston, S C.
div3.p: --Stockholders in the Steamship Calypso Company who have not yet exchanged their certificates for certificates of stock in the Consolidated Steamship Company, are hereby requested to do so without further delay, in order that they may be entitled to any dividend that may be declared.
div3.closer:
By order.
William S Heriot,
Sec'y Consolidated Steamship Co,
Charleston, S C. no 3--3t
